page.title: 05Dallacre Farm Estate 2
page.content: J.D.R fabrications make glass fibre musical instrument cases. The three men who work there design and make the cases. They make the moulds, cases, line the cases, paint them and put on the handles. They make cases for saxophones, cellos, violins, guitars and many other instruments. Cello cases are exported to Australia and saxophone cases to Sweden. The cases are sold and delivered all over the British Isles. Gun Safe make cabinets to keep sporting guns and ammunition safe. They have a caravan which they take to game fairs to sell their equipment. They export all over the world and also sell their cabinets privately. Photographic Processing is run by Mr.Kirkwood. He develops photographs, etc. which are sent all over the world. Mr.A.Thompson restores every make of car and his customers are mainly local.
